metadata.title: CVE-2024-35831 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:io_uring: Fix release of pinned pages when __io_uaddr_map fails Looking atthe error path of __io_uaddr_map, if we fail after pinning the pages forany reasons, ret will be set to -EINVAL and the error handler won'tproperly release the pinned pages. I didn't manage to trigger it withoutforcing a failure, but it can happen in real life when memory is heavilyfragmented.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35831` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
